p: The combination of pemetrexed with palbociclib enhanced the cytotoxicity of the antimetabolite in all cell lines tested ( Figure 5A–C). Importantly, the calculation of the combination index indicated a synergistic effect in all cases, with the cytotoxic evaluation being comparable to the results obtained when antiviral efficacy was measured ( Table 3). The combination of fluorouracil with palbociclib enhanced fluorouracil potency in TZM-bl and T47D cells but not in MDA-MB-468 cell line ( Figure 5A–C, Table 3). Interestingly, in MDA-MB-468 cells, although the expression of SAMHD1 was similar to other lines, Rb and pRb were not detected, either at the mRNA or protein level, ( Figure S3), demonstrating the importance of cell cycle proteins which putatively may affect SAMHD1 function in determining palbociclib–antimetabolite drug combination efficacy.
